185965419.review:
This was a game that I initially played when it came out as Metro 2033, I enjoyed that game so much that I sought out a UK-exclusive version of the book, which had not yet been brought to America by that point.

Replaying it now, I fear that I was a kid, and didn't really have the taste to be discerning. The thing that made this game so appealing to me at the time was the horror elements. Playing this now, the jank that was at one time endearing, presently, made this almost funnier than scary. And brother, there is a lot of jank.

I never played Last Light, because as I mentioned before, I loved the way this felt like a horror game at times. From everything I saw it became an action-stealth game, with plentiful ammo and health regen.

I'll FINALLY be giving Last Light a shot after hearing great things about Exodus.

I guess this should serve as a warning that replaying your favorite games years later can change the way that you feel about them.

I still love you, Артём.

185935447.review:
Metro 2033 Redux – Darkness, Despair, and the Occasional Radiation Tan

Ah, Metro 2033 Redux, the game that makes you question why you ever thought crawling through a post-apocalyptic subway system filled with mutated nightmares was a good idea. But hey, at least the lighting is great, right?

[hr][/hr]
[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*] [b]Atmosphere galore:[/b] The game is so immersive that you can practically feel the dampness of the tunnels and the crushing weight of existential dread.
[*] [b]Story-rich experience:[/b] A tale of survival, humanity, and wondering why Artyom doesn’t just find a nice bunker and call it a day.
[*] [b]Stunning visuals:[/b] The apocalypse has never looked so beautiful—or terrifying. You’ll stare at the scenery... right before something jumps out to eat you.
[*] [b]Stealth or chaos:[/b] Sneak past enemies like a shadow in the night or unleash fury with the kind of makeshift weapons that scream, "I ran out of duct tape halfway through."
[*] [b]Gas mask simulator:[/b] Nothing beats the thrill of wiping dirt and blood off your visor as you gasp for air. Peak immersion.
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*] [b]Ammo is currency:[/b] Every bullet you fire is a direct hit to your wallet. Want to survive? Hope you’re good at budgeting.
[*] [b]Tunnel vision:[/b] You’ll spend a lot of time underground. If you were hoping for open-world exploration, this isn’t it—unless you count the open world of horrific nightmares.
[*] [b]Mutants and bandits:[/b] These guys have clearly never heard of personal space.
[*] [b]Voice acting:[/b] Sometimes it’s a bit stiff, but hey, it’s the apocalypse; everyone’s probably too depressed to emote properly.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[b]Final Thoughts:[/b]
Metro 2033 Redux is a grim masterpiece that perfectly captures the bleakness of a world gone horribly wrong. It’s equal parts survival horror, story-driven drama, and a reminder to never take clean air and sunlight for granted.

[b]Rating:[/b] [i]9/10 – Come for the story, stay for the adrenaline, and cry over every wasted bullet.[/i]

185798183.review:
A Masterpiece in Survival Horror Reimagined

Metro 2033 Redux takes an already fantastic game and refines it into a smoother, more immersive experience while retaining the heart and soul of the original. Whether you're a returning fan or a newcomer to the series, this definitive version is the best way to dive into the haunting world of the Moscow Metro.

The first thing that stands out is the incredible atmosphere. The post-apocalyptic setting is beautifully recreated with stunning visuals, improved lighting, and detailed textures that bring the desolate tunnels and ruined surface to life. The Redux version enhances the oppressive and claustrophobic feeling of the Metro, making every moment feel tense and immersive. The sound design is equally impressive, with eerie echoes, distant growls, and the chilling creaks of an unstable world adding to the experience.

Gameplay improvements make Metro 2033 Redux much more accessible and enjoyable than the original. Borrowing mechanics from Metro: Last Light, the stealth is smoother, the controls are more responsive, and combat feels tighter and more dynamic. The ability to wipe your gas mask and other small quality-of-life changes help immerse you further into the survival experience.

The balance between action and survival is expertly handled. Resources like ammunition and filters are scarce enough to keep you on edge, but not so scarce that the game feels frustrating. Every encounter forces you to think carefully about whether to fight, sneak, or conserve your supplies. This balance adds to the game’s tension and makes it feel like a true survival challenge.

The story, adapted from Dmitry Glukhovsky’s novel, is a gripping tale of humanity’s struggle for survival in the shadow of nuclear devastation. You play as Artyom, a young man navigating a fractured world filled with mutants, rival factions, and moral dilemmas. The narrative is compelling and atmospheric, exploring themes of hope, fear, and the human condition. The Redux version does a great job of preserving the story while enhancing the experience with better pacing and smoother transitions.

The variety of difficulty modes also deserves praise. Whether you want a more action-oriented experience or a brutal survival challenge, Metro 2033 Redux has you covered. The “Survival” mode emphasizes resource scarcity and slow, deliberate gameplay, while “Spartan” mode offers a more action-heavy approach. This flexibility makes the game accessible to both casual players and hardcore survival fans.

Overall, Metro 2033 Redux is a brilliant remaster that improves on the original in almost every way. It delivers a haunting, immersive journey through one of the most atmospheric worlds in gaming, with refined gameplay and stunning visuals that hold up beautifully even today. If you love survival horror, gripping stories, or just want a unique and unforgettable gaming experience, Metro 2033 Redux is an absolute must-play.

185719001.review:
I am not a huge fan of fps, yet I heavily enjoyed every second of it. The story starts rather simple but gets infinitely better as you learn more about the world and characters. Dialogues are deep and meaningful, making each character interesting and lovable. I was amazed by Khan’s whole intriguing perspective on the subject of life and death, which came back to me many times as the plot develop.
However, my feeling toward its horror aspect is rather mixed. On one hand, I always love games that have effective lighting and sound effect design, setting atmosphere to provide the best immersion, which applies extremely well to the majority of the in-game exploration, especially the whole library section. On the other hand, random jumpscares sometimes can be really annoying and cheap, though it won‘t fully take away the built-up tension, it still left a bad taste in mouth.
Overall, a very solid start to the metro series, just hope the game can have more language option so that more people can get the chance to experience it.

Одной из главных сильных сторон игры является её сюжет. Глубокая и захватывающая история, полная неожиданных поворотов, заставляет игрока переживать за каждого персонажа. Атмосфера подземного мира, наполненного опасностями и загадками, передана на высшем уровне.

Графика в игре также заслуживает высших похвал. Улучшенные текстуры, освещение и модели персонажей делают мир Metro 2033 еще более реалистичным и детализированным. Особенно впечатляют моменты, когда выходишь на поверхность, и перед глазами открываются разрушенные улицы города, покрытые снегом и пеплом.

Геймплей представляет собой смесь стелса и экшена, где каждое решение может оказаться роковым. Разнообразие локаций, от тесных туннелей метро до открытых пространств на поверхности, добавляет игре динамики и не дает заскучать.

Звуковое сопровождение и фоновые звуки выполнены на высочайшем уровне. Музыка идеально подчеркивает напряженные моменты, а звуки шагов, дыхания и выстрелов создают полное погружение в игровой процесс.

Самая крутая фраза из игры, которая идеально описывает её дух: “Главное… что главное?! Главное  есть жёлтый снег!” Хахах cyк@ просто убила))

Metro 2033 Redux - это не просто игра, а настоящее приключение, которое стоит пройти каждому любителю атмосферных и захватывающих историй.

185625893.review: Being new to the metro series, I wasn't sure what to expect. The game has a unique atmosphere to it for sure, with the metro itself always making you feel a sense of unease. You feel relieved once you arrive at an outpost or receive help from fellow survivors. The game does not hold your hand at all, with minimal tutorials. The FPS part of it is fun, with most of the guns being viable options that can be adjusted to suit your play style. The game shows its age when it comes to the AI of the human enemies however. They are very "computer-like" and behave like a hive mind, communicating with each other your location telepathically. That's really my biggest complaint. If you are new to the series, the game does not make it clear (or at least I missed it) that there is a karma system, as in your actions in game affect the story. There is a good and a bad ending. The screen edges flash white when you perform something good, and black when bad to let you know if you're acting as intended. Overall, it's a great horror-fps single player experience, and would definitely recommend it.

185495213.review:
"A Haunting Journey Through the Depths of Post-Apocalyptic Russia!"
🌟 Rating: 9/10

Metro 2033 Redux is more than just a game—it's an experience. This enhanced version of the original classic brings unparalleled immersion, gripping storytelling, and atmospheric gameplay to life. If you’re a fan of survival horror and first-person shooters, this is a must-play.

🌌 Story and Atmosphere:
Set in the remnants of Moscow’s metro system after a nuclear apocalypse, the game plunges you into a dark, claustrophobic world teeming with danger. From eerie tunnels to the desolate surface, every location is dripping with atmosphere. The story, based on Dmitry Glukhovsky’s novel, is a compelling tale of survival, hope, and humanity’s struggle against extinction.

⚔️ Gameplay:
The blend of stealth, survival, and combat mechanics keeps you on edge. Resources like ammo and filters are scarce, forcing you to make every shot count. Whether you're sneaking past mutants or engaging in intense firefights with bandits, the tension never lets up.

🎨 Visuals and Redux Enhancements:
The Redux version brings stunning visual upgrades, improved lighting, and smoother gameplay. Every flicker of light, shadow, and particle effect adds to the game’s immersive realism. It’s the definitive way to experience this masterpiece.

🎧 Sound Design:
The sound design is phenomenal, with every creak, growl, and whisper pulling you deeper into the game’s chilling world. Play with headphones for the full effect—you won’t regret it.

💡 Conclusion:
Metro 2033 Redux isn’t just a game; it’s a journey through despair, hope, and survival. With its gripping narrative, atmospheric world, and challenging gameplay, it stands as one of the best post-apocalyptic experiences in gaming.

🚇 Are you ready to brave the darkness of the Metro and uncover its secrets?

185458956.review:
Dopo aver completato tutta la storia mi sono fatto un'idea di questo gioco e devo ammettere all'inizio non sapevo se metterla positiva o negativa.
La storia è molto bella, chiaramente ispirata dalla serie S.T.A.L.K.E.R., e generalmente semplice da seguire che ti catapulta in un mondo post-apocalittico dove le persone sopravvissute sono costrette a trovare rifugio in delle metropolitane poiché in superficie l'intera zona artica è governata, come parzialmente anche il sottosuolo, da esseri mutanti. Inoltre le armi in questo gioco sono molto originali, non sono infatti armi da fuoco classiche, ma sono prototipi costruiti con materiali di scarto che fungono proprio come armi da fuoco.
Ciò che ritengo essere negativo di questo gioco è principalmente il gameplay: L'immersività è quasi inesistente, il gioco ti piazza a dover seguire solo ed esclusivamente la storia, senza poter fare altro, dove per tutta la durata del gameplay non sarà nient'altro che sparare a dei mutanti o soldati di altri clan, devo dire avere la mira e resistenza di un soldatino di plastica, sommato al fatto che, a volte, non è ben chiaro cosa si deve fare, anche se questo è un punto minimo in confronto al resto. Tutto sommato, la storia di questo gioco merita molto e consiglio di provarlo almeno una volta. Voto 6.5/10

185402924.review:
Просто хорошая игра от украинских разработчиков, выходцев из компании подаривших нам Сталкер.

Прошёл игру за 12 часов и могу сказать что у игры есть один большой минус - это стрельба и общий шутерный  геймплей. Оружие хорошо чувствуется, но кажется каким-то слабым и игрушечным, особенно дробовики которые очень долго перезаряжаются и в тоже время плохо убивает противника, в обычного упыря можно выстрелить раз пять и о будет ещё живой и кусать тебя за зад, да и сами враги так и норовят прыгнуть на тебя с пол карты и сократить дистанцию для удара по тебе, плюс резкие движения противника мешают хорошо по нему попадать, особенно заметно это с маленькими врагами из главы где несём ребёнка к его маме.
Из касяков могу выделить еще отсутствие характеристик у оружие, не понятно на какую такую вундервафлю меняем своё оружие, будет оно хорошее или нет, при первом прохождении когда не знаешь как что себя ведёт это будет проблемой и поэтому будешь с опаской брать оружие с которым не знаком.
Так же игра оказалась очень простой на уровне выживание нормально, Артём кажется терминатором, походу задумывалось проходить на хардкоре, хотя слово хардкор в геймерских кругах кажется чём-то запредельно сложным и мало кто будет проходить на этой сложности.
Бывают редкие баги с нпс, но это не критично и софтлока не вызывают, кроме одного момента в библиотеке где гг просто умирает без анимации на пустом месте, хотя ты находишься в противогазе и с фильтром все хорошо, пришлось главу перезагружать.
Но в игре всё-таки больше плюсов, например:
Хорошо проработанный мир игры и атмосфера, классная кинематографичность игры, приятный стелс, хорошая графика и музыка, разнообразие гейплейных ситуаций и хороший экшен с людьми врагами, классный баланс элементов выживания, всегда есть патроны и фильты из-за чего игра не кажется тебе не честной, самое главное в такие моменты хоть чуть-чуть исследовать локацию и проблем с припасами не будет.
От меня оценка в 7.5/10
Ожидал больше, думал будет покруче, но и так остался доволен после прохождения, очень интересно пройти Last Light и узнать что нового внедрили разработчики чтобы улучшить геймплей.

185399566.review:
I was introduced to the Metro Series by word of mouth, And after Playing Metro 2033 and it's sequels I can wholeheartedly state that the Metro Franchise is a underrated gem in the FPS genre. 
[list]
    [*]It's atmosphere is by far some of the best I have seen in any game I have played thus far.
    [*]The gun-play is satisfying, and the customization of weapons gives the player full access to a multitude of load-outs at their disposal.
    [*]The Game has a decent story; with gives multiple outlooks and insights to the post-apocalyptic world it advertises.
[/list]
Overall a great game for anyone interested in a Story-Rich First-Person Shooter, and a great recommendation to anyone familiar in the FPS genre.

185394481.review: This game offers rather satisfying Gunplay and a very well crafted atmosphere. This is sadly where my praise ends. The plot and characters are disappointing at best, and the silent protagonist repeatedly not answering direct questions and prompts often ruins any immersion. The game fails at making me care about its protag who is bland and whose ambitions are poorly communicated. The game also refuses to tutorialze you. This can be good! Sometimes games can naturally teach you, like in other games (shovel knight just to name an example) but instead of making you interested in the games mechanics it refuses to tell you about them. At the start of the game you are given a battery and then not told what it does. I had to be told 5 hours in that the compass you are given points to the objective, not north. I still do not know what half the features in the game are supposed to do or in what way i would need them. Playing on hardcore i never found myself needing grenades or knives. I never needed more than a pistol and shotgun. The games enemies are repetitive and boring and unengaging. They dont have specific weaknesses or anything like that. Use gun. Shoot. I like the guns and i like the shoot but the (very promising and strong!!!) baseline never gets expanded upon. What makes all this worse is the sheer amount of jank and bugginess. Numerous times I had to reload at certain times to fix npcs getting stuck. The game very often poorly communicates your objectives as all you have is the instructions as the characters. Unless you have the memory of a god you will forget certain parts, and since the level design does not flow naturally at all you sometimes (albeit rarely) find yourself wandering about desperately searching for the objective. The real last straw came when I was at the start of what I assume is one of the last levels and the game just collapsed in on itself. As far as I can tell there is no way to reload old save files and my current one is literally unplayable. In a certain section an enemy simply teleports in, disabling my weapons and instakilling me. There is no way to get past. I checked a guide and it is definitely a bug. A game breaking one at that. I simply do not want to do another playthrough if the game can just end my run like that. I hear the sequel is a lot better but this has definitely made me very weary of playing it. Just buy Hollow Knight for this price. Or an expensive good game on sale.

185209959.review:
Das Spiel habe ich nunmehr zweimal durchgespielt, was bei mir überaus selten vorkommt. Gut, das Spiel ist auch in ca. 7 Stunden durchgespielt, was die Entscheidung leichter gemacht hat, es noch einmal zu spielen. Aber wäre es kein grandioses Spiel, hätte ich es nach dem Durchspielen sicherlich linksliegengelassen.

Metro 2033 basiert auf der Buch-Trilogie von Dimitri Alexejewitsch Glukhovski (die Trilogie steht bei mir im Bücherschrank und wartet noch darauf, gelesen zu werden). Die Ursprünge aus den Büchern kommen auch deutlich spürbar im Spiel zum Vorschein: Ein atmosphärisches dystopisches Russland wird mir als Schauplatz nähergebracht und die Welt wird narrativ durchdacht und schlüssig erzählt. Das Spiel ist in mehrere Kapitel und Unterkapitel eingeteilt, die alle vor dem Kapitelstart durch Artjoms Tagebucheinträge auditiv aus der Ich-Perspektive eingeleitet werden. Nebenher sammelt man noch weitere Tagebucheinträge unseres Protagonisten Artjom ein. Das Metro-Netzwerk sowie dessen Einheimische und die lauernden Gefahren werden beim Umherstreifen durch die Stationen beklemmend und heimelig zugleich dargestellt.

Das Spiel sticht vor allem durch seine Survival-Aspekte heraus, die damals im Jahr 2010 stark waren. Und trotzdem: Das Spiel kann heutzutage immer noch eine stimmige Atmosphäre schaffen, obwohl man dem Spiel auch in der aufgefrischten REDUX-Version sein Alter deutlich ansieht und der Gruselfaktor des Spiels nahezu ganz verpufft ist.

Was mir auch gut gefällt: Man ist häufig mit anderen Begleitenden unterwegs. Das schafft Nähe zu den Fraktionen und wird geschickt für das Storytelling genutzt, weil die Begleitenden dadurch viel von ihrer oder den anderen Fraktionen, den Mutanten etc. erzählen können. Damit schafft das Spiel einen guten Weg für das Worldbuilding. Für diese Spielreihe ungemein wichtig, denn die Buchvorlagen geben so einiges her – die Original-Trilogie umfasst über 2000 Seiten. Abseits davon: Dimitri Glukhovski ist Kremlkritiker und publiziert derzeit Sachbücher zum Putin-Regime. Er lebt im ausländischen Exil.

Ich freue mich ungemein, diese Spielreihe weiterspielen zu dürfen und kann das Spiel Survival-Shooter-Spielenden absolut empfehlen. Insbesondere Spielende, denen die S.T.A.L.K.E.R-Reihe gefällt, könnten großen Spaß an Metro haben, auch wenn die Metro-Reihe – Metro: Exodus hierbei etwas ausgenommen – sehr schlauchig im Leveldesign ist und die Open-World-Sparte nicht bedient.

185201927.review:
Metro se passa em uma Moscou destruída pela guerra nuclear. Sua superfície? congelada, morta. Seu ar? tóxico, sua natureza? corrompida além do reconhecimento pelos interesses e crenças fúteis do homem. 
Os poucos sobreviventes se abrigaram no subterrâneo, nos metrôs, que dão nome à franquia. seus túneis são frios, escuros e decadentes; a natureza lentamente toma de volta o que sempre foi dela por direito.
As estações, antigamente locais tão efêmeros no dia a dia das pessoas, se tornou a morada permanente dos azarados que ainda tem esperança de um dia ver a luz do sol novamente, e de todos aqueles que acham que essa luz já se apagou.
Debaixo das terra, grupos, organizações e nações surgem, e por tantas adversidades, são cada vez mais extremistas e distantes uma das outras... Comunistas, Nazistas, Guerreiros, todos se agarram a ideologias e ideias do velho mundo, se recusando a aceitar que esse velho mundo já morreu.
Além dos perigos da natureza e do homem, novos perigos do além surgem. As vozes dos mortos ainda ecoam pela escuridão, fenômenos além da compreensão humana ceifam vidas todos os dias, e rumores dizem que uma nova espécie consciente se ergue das cinzas de Moscou... A próxima etapa da evolução humana, o próximo Homo, aqui para nos substituir.
Esse é o mundo de Metro.
Quanto ao jogo?
No quesito Gameplay, ele não se diferencia em quase nada da maioria dos FPS no mercado, fora ser bem punitivo nas dificuldades mais altas e ter alguns poucos elementos de sobrevivência, a principal sendo a máscara de gás, que precisa ser reabastecida com filtros que você encontra pelo mundo, e que, ao menos que você fique zanzando por muito tempo sem necessidade, quase nunca faltam durante todo o jogo.
Mas fica só por isso, ainda é um jogo de ação.
A Inteligência artificial dos inimigos não fede nem cheira, não é ruim mas não se destaca em nada também
A movimentação é meio arrastada, mas você se acostuma e começa a ignorar isso depois.
Além dos filtros, munição também é abundante e quase nunca falta, mesmo nas dificuldades mais altas.
O jogo no geral, tem uma gameplay bem normal, talvez até genérica, com a exceção de alguns trechos, como as do carro, que são bem únicas e interessantes... Mas esse não é o ponto forte dele.

O que eu considero sim, ser seu ponto forte, é sua atmosfera incrível, seus cenários de tirar o fôlego, e sua ambientação única. Esse mundo te prende de um jeito assustador, você se sente lá, na pele do Artyom. Você consegue sentir a melancolia daquele lugar, a tristeza nas ruínas, ver o mundo que já foi tão belo e cheio de vida... morto, escuro, frio, destruído pela ganância do homem. Eu acabava me perguntando constantemente... As coisas não poderiam ter sido diferentes? Não podem ser diferentes? Vale a pena continuar lutando, mesmo sem nenhum semblante de esperança, ou esse mundo já está condenado? Nesse aspecto o jogo é impecável até o fim.
A história é boa, e tem um tom surpreendentemente otimista pro mundo que ela se passa, e em nenhum momento eu senti que o roteiro perdia a direção, sempre tem um objetivo definido.
Os personagens são mais ou menos, tem ali uma meia dúzia que se destacam e são bem marcantes, mas a maioria são esquecíveis... entretanto, Isso é algo que melhora nos jogos seguintes! o Last Light tem personagens bem melhores e o Exodus tem um cast sensacional.
Tecnicamente falando, o jogo é bom. É muito bem otimizado, tem pouquíssimos bugs. Minha única reclamação é quanto ao áudio, que fica constantemente cortando e travando, mas eu já não tenho certeza se esse é um problema do jogo ou do meu computador.

Enfim... Essa review já tá longa demais. O jogo é muito bom, podem jogar tranquilos, deixem na wishlist, peguem numa promoção, dá pra se divertir bastante e ocupar o tempo por umas boas 7 ou 8 horas de duração da campanha. Obrigado por ler!!

185184664.review:
I only finished the game once. However, I can say the game is actually pretty good and it makes me wonder how nice it would be to have more books as videogames.

As for now before doing a few more runs and without getting into much detail I can say that the game as a whole feels nice. The combat is simple but yet intense, you can chose between going full rambo-mode or stealth. Also, The history itself is not bad but nothing extraordinary in my opinion(I liked more metro lastlight history), sometimes it feels as if things happens just because. The thing I really fell in love with was the atmosphere of the game, almost in every chapter of the game you are inside the metro, which creates this tense vibe that makes you feel you can't run away if anything happens and makes you really conscious of you surroundings.

After talking so nice about the game I have to say something bad, so here it comes. I don't now the exact reason but it happened a few times to me in different parts of the game, sometimes the NPCs get somehow bugged and they won't continue with the dialogue or with the next action they need to do for the campaign to continue, so you will have to restart and play again from the last chekcpoint. I believe it sometimes may happen because of something you do, like going to fast to the next place without waiting for the NPC or things like that. This also happened to me in lastlight, but only once. As I said, here it happend multiple times, which I didn't really mind when it was just after a checkpoint, but there was once when I had to repeat a full chapter of the game beacuse of this. Not good

I'll probably do a few more runs to the game in the future, so I will probably edit the review but for now to sum everything I said now:
 
Combat is great      9/10
History is not bad   7/10
Atmosphere and level desing can't be better  11/10

Overall grade: 9/10 + 1 because you drink a lot of vodka for some reason and i like that so 10/10

185180601.review:
不推荐。

玩法为标准的FPS，剧情演绎很好，第一人称视角下表现不俗，抛开画质放到现在也很能看。游戏的美术可以概括成两种，一种是冰雪覆盖的废墟城市景观，一种是阴暗潮湿黑不溜秋的地洞要塞景观，第一种很好看但是只占整个游戏20%不到，剩下的几乎都是第二种。

引导非常弱，也可以说差。交互对象基本没有明显突出特征，游戏内又没有任务提示。导致转半天不知道要干什么。点名表扬图书馆第二扇门开门的设计，好好的FPS游戏，突然给整个全游戏唯一的物理解谜设计，前不着村后不着店，不知道制作人哪来的幽默细胞搞这种东西。

关卡设计绝对有问题，从第五章“希望”开始，路上基本捡不到补给，弹药越打越少。我来到最后一章由于前面最近的几章一直捡不到补给，只能纯靠NPC队友的枪来替我打怪。最后塔顶剧情点处更是弹尽粮绝。队友被怪击中了奄奄一息叫我射击怪物，我倒是想啊，三把枪一颗子弹都没有。没有地方捡弹，流程就卡在这里了，读档重来队友就继续重演牺牲一刻。剧情本意是好的，关卡设计给执行坏了。我以为要死档了，最后扔了颗雷解决了。那我要是连雷都没有，那我要怎么办呢？

其他的诸如怪物机动性过于强、换弹过慢、所有关卡都用滤嘴时间来隐性限时、枪械常态无准星，我暂且认为是不对我胃口。

无简中，高中英语水平基本能看懂。

总结，缺点比优点更明显。

185168136.review:
Gameplay 8/10
Metro 2033: Redux has a simple yet effective gameplay, reflecting perfectly well the atmosphere of the game. Nothing too complex and good freedom in a linear FPS game. The inventory is nice, but you quickly learn the value of money, which is, to put it simply, pretty useless. Sure, you can customize your weapons, but you can also find the ones you want already pumped up, out in the open. The real value would most likely be the bullets, but I guess it depends on the difficulty you’re playing. All in all, it’s pretty well done, solid concepts and well thought. I was stressed about the amount of oxygen you have on the surface and hazardous environment, but if you take the time to explore, you should have everything you need. The fights are good, fast, brutal, and the game really shines when you fight humans.

Graphics 10/10
F*ck me this looks good! One of the best engines I’ve seen in a long time, plenty deserving of it’s praised. The lighting effect, the water, the gore, simply gorgeous. If the goal was to immerse you in a post-apocalyptic wasteland, bravo!

Audio 5/10
One of the weakest links of Metro 2033: Redux. Once outside, in the wilderness, you can hear a lot of things. A LOT. For a place supposedly deserted, monsters scream every 5 seconds, close or far, and sometimes even in places where they are not (not kidding) There is also background noise, like movements and monsters screaming (shocking, I know), that repeats every 30 seconds or so. It’s cool in the beginning, it helps sets the tone of the game, the constant stress of being attacked, but it quickly becomes irritating and can even leads to ambush where you thought this was just another random scream or background noise but this time, proved to be true… Oh, and everybody sounds like Bourbon…

Story x/10
I’ll leave it at ‘x’, simply because I couldn’t finish the game. Yeah, you read that right. After a short while, I became stuck. Bourbon (I guy you follow to the surface) simply gets stuck somewhere and this is it, end of the line. I’m supposed to follow him, but he just stands there, doesn’t move, nothing. A reload changes nothing, he gets stuck at the same place, over and over and over again…

Replayability 0/10
Yeah, 0 to the none. I can’t recommend or judge replayabilty if I can’t even finish the game in the first place… Too bad, really, I really liked this game, but be aware of the possibility this might happen to you, if you choose to buy the game…

Innovation 6/10
Well, I think there were some cool concepts in this game. The oxygen limitations offered a nice stress on the surface, and the environment offered enough liberty to explore. No puzzles, but you still have to search a little, if you want to unlock the safes scattered around the world (you’ll see). The money mechanics is also a nice touch. Having to think about your resources in this kind of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game is cool. 

Overall 6/10
Look. I think Metro 2033: Redux is an excellent game and deserves more than a 6/10. But the bug I encountered prevented me from recommending it anyway. I can’t, in good conscience, tell any of you to buy this, and risk being stuck like me. You will be freakily disappointed not being able to continue and simply uninstall it with a really bad taste in your mouth: disappointment.

185116125.review:
Если коротко — Metro 2033 Redux просто шикарна. Это не просто игра, а целое приключение, которое не отпускает до самого конца. Я давно не встречал таких проектов, где чувствуешь себя буквально частью этого мрачного, но завораживающего мира.
Сюжет — огонь. История Артёма, который пробирается через заброшенные туннели московского метро, полные мутантов, опасностей и воспоминаний о прошлом, реально цепляет. Мне особенно понравилось, как игра показывает людей, которые пытаются выжить в такой ситуации. Кто-то сохраняет человечность, а кто-то превращается в монстра.
Геймплей тоже радует. Здесь всё на выживание — каждый патрон на вес золота, а каждый выстрел может стать последним. Мне очень зашло, что можно играть по-разному: хочешь — идёшь напролом, хочешь — крадёшься в тени. А звуки… Это просто что-то. Шёпоты в туннелях, скрипы, шаги — иногда становится по-настоящему страшно.
Но главное — атмосфера. Она такая густая, что кажется, будто чувствуешь запах сырости и слышишь гул поездов. Пару раз я ловил себя на мысли, что просто остановился и смотрю на разбитые декорации, внимаю этому миру.
Если вам нравятся сильные эмоции и атмосферные игры — обязательно попробуйте Metro! Для меня это одна из тех игр, которые остаются в памяти надолго.

It's such a shame this game sucks the way it does, because it has potential to be something good. 
The whole idea of being underground, in a metro, aliens and warfare, how could it fail, it sounds awesome!
But boy oh boy...

This game is such a mess.
All from the flow of the game to the technical aspects.. 
 I sometimes get kicked out from the game as if it crashes. my character started shooting out of nowhere on reloading and automatically aiming whilst doing it (what even..?!), textures missing on load for clicking too fast through the loading screen.
I have had the game crash on me for picking up an item. The 3d audio is a jumbled mess, you can only hear people talk when you look at them (HUH?)
There's just so much crap that screws the player over for no reason. 

Oh the mission is too long and you have no air filters left? Restart then. Bro.. At least give me the shop so i can utilize my currency whenever i want to stock up. It's never clear whether it's going to be a long winded mission or not, will we go to the dangerous metro, or above the ground or both? How do i know the metro will have wastes (you don't), how will you know if you go back up to the surface (sometimes they tell you, sometimes they don't) they do 0 exposition for whatever i'm gonna do and they make damn sure you're gonna suffer for it.
It's also amazing to me how you can play through an entire game and still not know what the endgoal was. They do an incredibly poor job at explaining the very fundamentals which is a shame.

Patch and fix your game, it shouldn't have to be this way..

184947547.review: After one third of the game, I find that: I like very much the ambiance, the setting, the story, the characters. However, the combat feels a bit off. First, enemies (especially beasts) attack too quick, while your movement and shooting and reloading is slow; second, you are a bullet-sponge, without any armor or technical device that makes it make sense; normally it would not be a problem, but in a game that strives to be realistic (short-lived filters in the gas mask!) it breaks the immersion. I would have expected far fewer enemies to kill, with more consequential hits. (This is a first playthrough on easy mode.) Also, I appreciate the effort to innovate with a HUD-less screen (and I am thankful that there are no pointless RPG elements!) however managing the inventory is so counter-intuitive that I needed to check online many times how things worked. Probably an old-style, thorough exposition of the mechanics prior to the game start would have been a good idea. Finally: this is a gun-centric game. I wonder if the gun designers have ever seen a gun in real life, or spent one hour at the range!? How come the guns have no semi-auto mode? And what about the custom hand grip under the barrel of a *revolver*, which is impossible because the exhaust from the chamber would severely harm your hand (this is a reason why revolving rifles were not a thing). Again, very cheap immersion breaking in a game that strives so much to be realistic.

СТОЙ!! рецепт вкусного борща;)
1.сварить мясо(варить 1 час в кастрюле)
2.нарезать капусту(на 2.5л воды 1/4 кочана капусты)
3.почистить 3 картошки, 1 морковь, 1 лук и 1 свекла.
4.добавить перец по вкусу.
5.нарезать картоху мелким кубиком.
6.натереть морковь,свеклу, лук мелко порезать.
7.при закипании мяса убрать пенку.
8.после закипания мяса добавить к нему крупных, мелкопорезаных веточек укропа.
9.добвить щепотку соли к мясу.
10.убрать огонь до среднего.
11.добать картошку в кострюлю к мясу и укропу.
12.варить это все 5-7 мин. после закипания.
13.во время варки мяса обжарить на сковородке лук(добавить растительного масла 1 столовую ложку. Лук должен слегка прозрачным)
14.добавить морковь к луку, а через 2 мин. свеклу.
15.томить овощи 4 мин.
16.после 7 мин. варки мяса с картошкой, добавить капусту.
17.добавить пережареные овощи к мясу, картошке и капусте.
18.добавить 2 лавровых листика и чуть чуть перца.
19.даждаться пока закипит, после убрать пенку.
20.убавить огонь меньше среднего.
21.добавить мелконарезаный укроп(если есть желание добавить мелконарезаную петрушку)
22.доварить на медленном огне 5 мин.
23.выключить огонь и дать настояться 10 мин.
24.положить в тарелку и попробовать наше хрючево
Приятного аппетита!!

184919685.review:
Проходил игру с любовью, стараясь без интернета сам разобраться во всем и изучить. Прошел 3 раза, даже на самом сложном уровне.
Вывод: что понравилось: 
1) Может немного графика, потому что свое славянское, но ее особенно полюбоваться не дают, из за монстров и выживания.
Вывод: что не понравилось:
 1)  Не только в этой части но и в последующих главный герой обычный даун который не в состоянии связать два слова, хотя с ним говорят часами. Это ругают даже ленивые, но разрабам все равно.
2) Интуитивно вообще не понятно что от тебя хотят, куда идти в некоторых местах висел несколько дней пока не посмотрел ролики на ютубе, уже терпение кончилось.
3) Постоянно перехватывают своими роликами твое управление, куда то подкидывают или что еще делают, словно ты недееспособный
4) Баланса ноль. Враги тупые как пробки на любом уровне. Оружие некоторые даже не пригодилось так как бесполезное.
5) Монстры ваще задница. Даже если знаеш откуда прийдут. и не дай бог ты их не пристрелил из дали их, в упор бесполезно, как сарделька матыляется перед тобой хрен попадеш. Некоторые вообще чтоб убить нужно выпустить весь боезапас.
6) Из игры узнал, что  сложность уровня это не более умные хитрые враги, или хотя бы с более большим хп, а сложность уровня это когда ты не видиш что подобрал, сколько у тебя патронов, что ты кинул во врага, и сложность это среди нарисованой графики везде  тыкать пытаясь разобраться декарация это или можно взять или открыть.
7) Симулятор перезагрузок на любом уровне.
9) Сохранения вообще имба. Обшарив часть библиотеки и заглянув в каждый угол и контейнер и дойдя до контрольной точки, продолжив на следующий день с удивлением узнал на самом сложном, что я опять должен выпустить весь боезапас возле библиотеки и опять должен шариться по тем же контейнерам. Полная дрочь.
      Прошел только потому что отдал деньги и любопытство разобрало, что там все так хвалят. Не знаю мне не понравилась. Короче пойдет в памяти осталась.

184912466.review: 废土公路片。不同于辐射的美式幽默，地铁要更加沉重。冷峻的画面风格展示核战后莫斯科幸存者的百态：或是蜷缩地下，默默生活；又或是占山为王，抢夺成性；更有物质恶劣下仍然如火如荼的意识形态之间的斗争。深入地下，压抑阴暗的环境让人喘不过气；偶尔回到莫斯科，浪潮般的nosalis和难缠的demon继续施加压力。防毒面具的屏幕效果、手动充电器、融入游戏的任务列表，一切都为了真实营造出《地铁2033》的氛围。本作的弹药管理并不严格，黑灯状态下瞎子般的敌人省去了无谓的子弹消耗。不过由于环境的高度同质化，一不注意可能会迷路；任务提示不足，图书馆击落吊灯相当抽象，大概是制作组灵机一动的想法。隐藏的道德点设计无可厚非，给线性流程增加一定的重玩性。打折价格相当于白送。

184823548.review:
My review is the same as it was for the original game. If you have only played the original, then you might be wondering if it is worth revisiting. Unless you really want to replay the game, I would say no.

The UI is different, the lighting a little less dark. Not necessarily worse, but redux offers a different atmosphere. There are new environmental effects and the graphics are improved. Whilst the story is the same, as are characters and weapons, the difficulty feels toned down. I had no problems completing redux on Ranger difficulty. One noticeable thing is the addition of collectables such as diary entries which can be read when collected.

Here is a quick summery of the gameplay from my original review.
Gameplay involves venturing through the amazingly atmospheric metro system armed with a choice of three guns and a knife. You will visit refuge stations with a chance of a breather and the opportunity to mingle with the locals. Perhaps stock up on bullets and health packs, then it is back to the tunnels, occasionally with support. When you venture outside the metro system, you will need to manage your gas mask as the outside world is radiated to hell and back.

The game is linear and focused. No open world shenanigans here. You always have a single goal for each mission and a compass if you get stuck. You can stealth your way around missions or go in guns blazing.

Truly Amazing Game!

The story is fantastic, and the fast-paced combat on Spartan mode is incredibly satisfying. It took me about 8 hours to finish, and the action scenes, combined with the rapid combat, really get your heart racing. Even when I wasn’t playing, I kept thinking about it.

Though it's an older game, it's still 100% worth playing—especially since the Redux version makes it look so much better than before.

Here’s what happened in the first two hours: I arrived at a station and met a cute girl who said she had a surprise for me. She led me to her room and told me to close my eyes. The next thing I know, a HUGE guy is staring me down and bam—hits me right in the face! It really hurt, and to top it off, he robbed me.

Despite that, it’s a great game. I’d give it a solid 9/10, but I’m knocking off one point because... well, f$$k Nikki.

184732675.review:
Metro 2033 Redux is a game that throws you into a post-apocalyptic metro and makes you feel like a mole crawling through dark tunnels. You’re always scavenging for ammo (which is also your currency) and raiding stalker stashes, trying not to become mutant food. I spent about 8 hours playing, "vacuuming" up everything in sight, and honestly, at times, I felt less like Artyom and more like a professional ammo collector.

Artyom barely speaks (except for the intro and through his diary), but the atmosphere speaks volumes. Creepy whispers, mutant growls, and those rare moments on the surface where every breath feels like a borrowed one—it’s all incredible. I played on "Ranger" difficulty, and trust me, it’s no joke. One wrong step and you're mutant chow.

Now, I’m planning to play it again, but this time fully in stealth mode. The rules are simple: don’t kill anyone, help everyone I meet, and collect all 51 pages of Artyom’s diary. I’m going for the good ending this time, and it’s going to be tough, but totally worth it. This game makes you feel like you're surviving against all odds, crawling through tunnels while holding on to whatever bit of hope you can find.

If you want a game that's immersive, challenging, and will turn you into an underground scavenger, Metro 2033 Redux is definitely worth checking out.

184693733.review:
Десять лет не играл в "Метро". В оригинал играть...почему-то не хочется, хотя, наверное, стоило бы.

Но мне и Redux зашла, тем более, что, считай, прохожу по новой: переиздание же.

Итак, чего хорошего:

1) Как бы ты ни играл, концовка - хорошая. Проходи, как знаешь. Одной из концовок, конечно, надо будет добиваться, но это - одна из тех частей "Метро", где это - не совсем обязательно и больше зависит от личного подхода. Это потом хорошие и плохие концовки станут иметь более серьёзные последствия.

2) Огнемёт. Обожаю. Самый лучший игровой огнемёт, без @#ёв. 

3) Это - начало мира "Метро", со всеми тайнами и опасностями его. И атмосферой, конечно же.

4) Много-много-много уголков для исследования, хороших и разных. Всегда приятно посмотреть, куда надо идти, чтобы просто отойти на чуток и пошарить по сторонам, может, найдётся чего интересного: записочка там, патрошки, ещё чего...

5) Персонажи. Живые и правдоподобные.

6) Монстры. Много. Страшные. Очень просят огнемёта. И упоминания в списке сильных сторон игры. Да.

Впрочем. было бы нечестно не упомянуть и недостатки, многие из которых потом были улучшены.

1) Музыка. Очень любит "зависать" и приедаться. Это - переиздание, поэтому музон перешёл прямо из "Луча Надежды". Только если в "Луче" он знает, когда и что играть, тут он может просто "забыть" об этом. В итоге, прихожу я такой к маленькому мальчику Саше, ребёнок - в слезах, пытается "разбудить" усопшего дядю, видит меня, вооружённого и страшного, умиляющегося невинности бедного дитя, играет музыка...прерывающаяся бодрым боевым треком. В итоге, отключил музыку вообще. Благо, в нужный момент она всё равно будет играть, а всякий фон мне - не нужен. Ау, игра, что за фигня?

2) Ну зачем, м-мать его, было заменять нож, шедший за отдельное оружие, на Call of Duty-подобную "атаку"? Если в CoD нож доставался на лету и быстро (за что мне и нравился), то здесь это сильно зависит от "тяжести" оружия. То есть, если у тебя в руках - автомат, допустим, до ножа - пол-Вселенной.

3) Уже писал в обзоре на "Луч Надежды", как я ненавижу патронную систему обмена: учитывая, как мало боеприпасов находится в мире "Метро", тратить боевые патроны на покупку чего-то выглядит пустой тратой времени и денег, особенно, учитывая то, что через пару станций купленный ствол придётся менять на лежалый дробовик, к которому к этому времени патронов накопится навалом. Это - притом, что патронов таскать - можно только ограниченное количество, ограниченность никак не объясняется, и, по итоге, не раз и не два выйдет так, что, исстреляв всё, что было, подобрать будет нечего и неоткуда, потому что всё, что можно было бы добрать, осталось за плотно заваренной дверью в предыдущую комнату, где осталось всё то, что не поместилось в карман до того, как исрасходовал всё, что "поместилось". Ау, игра, что за фигня?

Но на этом, в общем-то, всё. Оригинальной игре оценке не могу поставить, но поставлю переизданию, благо, ощущается она в самом деле, как предтеча "Луча Надежды" и "Исхода".

9 из 10

184579353.review:
Metro 2033 Redux ist ein atmosphärisches Meisterwerk, das Spieler tief in eine düstere, postapokalyptische Welt eintauchen lässt. Die Mischung aus Survival-Horror, fesselnder Story und taktischem Gameplay schafft eine einzigartige Spielerfahrung. Die überarbeitete Redux-Version glänzt durch verbesserte Grafik, realistischere Beleuchtung und flüssigere Performance, wodurch die bedrückende Atmosphäre der Moskauer Metro noch intensiver wirkt.

Besonders beeindruckend sind die Details der Spielwelt – von belebten Stationen bis zu den klaustrophobischen Tunneln – sowie die emotionalen Begegnungen mit NPCs. Das Ressourcenmanagement und die Entscheidung, ob man schießt oder schleicht, machen jede Mission spannend. Die gelegentlichen Mängel in der KI fallen kaum ins Gewicht, da die Story und das Gameplay überzeugen.

Ein Muss für Fans von tiefgründigen Geschichten und beklemmendem Survival-Horror!

184550095.review:
Metro 2033 Redux is a remastered version of the original Metro 2033 released in 2010. This game delivers an FPS (First-Person Shooter) experience with elements of survival horror and a strong narrative set in a post-apocalyptic world.  

Metro 2033 Redux Review (Steam):
⭐ Gameplay:
Metro 2033 Redux offers smoother and improved gameplay compared to the original. Stealth, combat, and survival mechanics are well-refined. The atmosphere of Moscow’s underground is haunting, adding tension at every turn.  

⭐ Graphics and Visuals:
Using the Metro: Last Light engine, the graphics appear more realistic and detailed. Lighting effects, textures, and animations have been upgraded, creating an immersive environment.  

⭐ story and Atmosphere:
The narrative remains one of the game’s strongest aspects. Players follow **Artyom’s** journey in a world full of mutants and dangers. The dark atmosphere and deep storytelling make the game highly memorable.  

⭐ Performance and Optimization:  
The Redux version brings better optimization, allowing the game to run smoothly even on mid-range systems. Loading times are faster, and previously persistent bugs have been addressed.  

⭐ Replayability and Value:
Metro 2033 Redux offers two game modes:  
- Survival Mode – Provides a more intense experience with limited resources.  
- Spartan Mode – Delivers faster, action-oriented gameplay similar to Metro: Last Light.  

Final Score:  
- Graphics: 9/10  
- Gameplay: 8.5/10  
- Story: 9/10  
- Atmosphere: 9.5/10  
- Optimization: 8.5/10  

Overall: 9/10  

Conclusion:  
Metro 2033 Redux is a great choice for fans of narrative-driven and survival games. This version offers both new and returning players a chance to experience the classic story with modern enhancements.

184543984.review:
[b]Genel Bakış[/b]


Metro 2033 Redux, Dmitry Glukhovsky’nin ünlü romanından uyarlanan ve insanlığı yeraltına çeken bir kıyamet sonrası hikayesini aktarıyor. Atmosferi ile beni içine çeken bu oyun, Moskova’nın nükleer savaş sonrası karanlık ve tehlikeli metrolarında hayatta kalma mücadelesi sunuyor. Redux versiyonu, yenilenmiş grafikleri ve bazı iyileştirilmiş mekanikleriyle eski bir klasiği tekrar canlandırıyor.

[b]Oynanış Mekanikleri[/b]
Oynanış, daha çok kaynak yönetimi, keşif ve gerilim dolu çatışmalar üzerine kurulu. Cephane sınırlı, hava filtreleri tükenmek üzere ve düşmanlar sizi her köşede bekliyor. Karanlık tünellerde ilerlerken çevremi dikkatle kontrol etmek zorunda kalıyorum; bazen saklanıp fark edilmemeyi tercih ederken, bazen kaçınılmaz olarak silahıma sarılıyorum. Silah mekanikleri tatmin edici ancak bazı düşman yapay zekâlarının tepkileri sıradan kalıyor.

Oyunun büyük bir kısmı oldukça çizgisel. Bu çizgisel yapı, hikaye anlatımı açısından derinlik sunarken, açık dünya hissi arayanlar için hayal kırıklığı yaratabilir. Bununla birlikte, seçim yapma özgürlüğünün belirli anlarda etkili olması, hikayeyi kişiselleştirme açısından güçlü bir artı.

[b]Grafikler ve Ses[/b]
Redux, geliştirilmiş görselleriyle etkileyici bir deneyim sunuyor. Ortam tasarımı ve ışıklandırma, kıyamet sonrası atmosferi başarıyla yansıtıyor. Tünellerin dar, klostrofobik yapısı ve yüzeydeki ıssız, radyoaktif bölgeler, gerilim hissini artırıyor. Ses tasarımı ise tamamen immersif; gaz maskesinin buğulanması, karakterin soluk alıp verişleri ve mutantların çıkardığı ürkütücü sesler gerçekten gergin anlar yaşatıyor. Ancak zaman zaman bazı çevresel sesler tekrarlayıp çeşitlilik eksikliği hissettirebiliyor.

[b]Hikaye ve Atmosfer[/b]
Metro 2033 Redux, güçlü bir hikaye anlatımıyla dikkat çekiyor. Ana karakter Artyom’un yolculuğunda yaşadığı insanlık dramları, mutantlarla savaşlar ve diğer hayatta kalanlarla etkileşimler unutulmaz bir hikaye deneyimi sunuyor. Ancak oyun, sadece hikaye anlatımıyla değil, aynı zamanda atmosferiyle de etkiliyor. Yeraltında yaşanan gerilim, yüzeye çıkıldığında korku ve çaresizliğe dönüşüyor.

[b]Pozitif:[/b]

-Kıyamet sonrası atmosferi ve hikaye anlatımı harika
-Kaynak yönetimi ve hayatta kalma mekanikleri dengeli
-Redux versiyonundaki görsel yenilikler etkileyici
-Ses tasarımı, gerilim ve gerçekçiliği artırıyor

[b]Negatif:[/b]

-Çizgisel yapı, bazı oyuncular için kısıtlayıcı olabilir
-Düşman yapay zekâsı zaman zaman zayıf kalabiliyor
-Çeşitlilik eksikliği, özellikle tekrar oynama durumunda hissediliyor

[b]Genel Değerlendirme[/b]
[b]Oynanış:[/b] 8/10 (Gerilim dolu ancak bazı eksiklikleri var)
[b]Grafikler:[/b] 9/10 (Redux yenilikleriyle görsel açıdan tatmin edici)
[b]Hikaye/Amaç:[/b] 9/10 (Kuvvetli hikaye ve atmosfer)
[b]Genel:[/b] 8.5/10

[b]Sonuç[/b]
Metro 2033 Redux, kıyamet sonrası hayatta kalma oyunlarını sevenler için kaçırılmayacak bir deneyim sunuyor. Karanlık metro tünellerinde geçen bu gerilim dolu hikaye, güçlü anlatımı ve görsel atmosferiyle etkileyici bir yolculuk yaşatıyor. Çizgisel yapısı ve düşman yapay zekâsındaki eksiklikler herkese hitap etmeyebilir, ancak sağlam bir atmosfer ve derin bir hikaye arayanlar için bu eksiklikler göz ardı edilebilir. Hem eski hem de yeni oyuncuların keyif alacağı bir oyun.

184399084.review:
game cannot achieve native resolution of 1440p
everything is stretched out and extra thicc

seems to be a known bug
just refund if you encounter the same problem as it is a hassle to fix

if you do decide to fix it
here's the solution:

Go to the configuration file(s) location.
Windows %LOCALAPPDATA%\4A Games\Metro Last Light\user.cfg
Steam %LOCALAPPDATA%\4A Games\Metro Last Light\<user-id>\user.cfg
Open user.cfg.
Change r_fullscreen on to r_fullscreen off.
Download Special K[github.com]
Copy SpecialK64.dll to the installation folder.
Rename SpecialK64.dll to dxgi.dll.
Start the game and exit.
Open dxgi.ini in the installation folder.
Set Borderless=true and Fullscreen=true under [Window.System].
Set OverrideRes=0x0 to the resolution of your screen (e.g. OverrideRes=1920x1080).
Start the game

For a game from 2014 it sure aged like milk, I have played so many older games that hold up so much better.

A lot of it feels inconsistent, loads of moments where you go "Am I meant to wait now?", "Is something supposed to happen now? followed by you just barely not triggering the cutscene hitbox or missing something very miss-able.
It's stuff like this that made the gameplay feel unpolished, getting 1 hit by certain things because of lack of explanation got old very quickly.

Graphically Metro 2033 is still strong, everything else that the game does just doesn't hold up well.
The game is only 2 bucks though it also is about 6-7 hours long with a lacklustre ending with realism and inconsistencies taking away the fun.

184291735.review:
《地铁2033：重制版》作为一款末世题材的第一人称射击游戏，以其深沉的氛围和引人入胜的剧情受到了许多玩家的喜爱。它成功再现了迪米特里·格鲁克夫斯基同名小说的末世世界，带来了极具沉浸感的体验。但在光辉背后，也存在一些需要注意的细节。  

首先，游戏的氛围无疑是其最大亮点之一。从废弃地铁隧道到荒芜的地表，每一处场景都被塑造得既压抑又真实。然而，游戏整体偏暗的画面表现可能会让部分玩家感到疲劳，尤其是在长时间游玩后，难免会有视觉上的疲惫感。虽然这样的光线处理很契合末世氛围，但对视力不佳或喜欢明亮画面的玩家来说，可能是一种挑战。  

游戏的AI设计值得肯定但也略显苛刻。敌人的感知力较高，尤其是在潜行模式下，很容易被发现。要想做到全程不杀人，就需要玩家保持极大的耐心和精准的策略规划。这种高要求虽然增强了游戏的挑战性，但也可能对新手玩家造成一定的挫败感。不过，这种设定也为那些喜欢考验自己耐心与技巧的玩家提供了充分的发挥空间。  

总体来说，《地铁2033：重制版》是一款优秀的作品，它通过精致的场景设计、沉浸感极强的氛围，以及细腻的剧情刻画，将玩家拉入了一个危机四伏的地下世界。尽管它的光线和AI设计对部分玩家来说可能有些苛刻，但正是这种硬核风格成就了它的独特魅力。如果你喜欢挑战自我，或者想体验一个真正末世感的游戏世界，这款游戏值得一试。

184255558.review:
Metro 2033 was my first-ever horror game, and let me tell you, I didn't expect to enjoy it as much as I did. It's a short and relatively simple game, so there isn't too much to write about, but here are some of my experiences:


• The game excels in creating dark [b]immersive atmosphere[/b]. Whether it's creepy metro tunnels or icy outside world, I always felt the sense of dread and danger. It nails that vibe so well that I half-expected to find a mutant under my bed IRL.

• In terms of the [b]story[/b], I'm a bit conflicted. I love the unique setting and how it introduces this beautifully crafted world, but I feel that there just isn't enough emotional depth to it. Barely any time is given to the development of the characters, and the fact that Artyom is a silent protagonist makes it even worse, because most of the time it feels like he has no personality at all. The diary entries offer a glimpse into Artyom's thoughts, but they are too brief to fully flesh out his personality.

• The game features a [b]hidden morality system[/b] that tracks your actions. Which basically means that the way you play the game affects the ending. While I enjoy games with moral choices, the lack of transparency about how your actions affect the outcome can be frustrating. Additionally, the sequels only continue from one ending, so if you got the "non-canonical" ending, well... congrats! Not only your choices were meaningless, but now you also have to google how the other ending looks like before getting into Last Light! On the bright side, getting canonical ending is hundred times easier, so it should not be a problem for most players.

• As I mentioned before, this game excels in creating immersion, and this applies to the [b]gameplay[/b] elements as well. You will need to count bullets like they are your life savings, monitor radiation levels, swap gas mask filters before you start choking, and charge battery-powered devices. What I loved the most is that the tools like compass, radiation meter, and quest log are physical items in the game, so the HUD is kept to a minimum. [b]Minimal HUD[/b] means maximum immersion. In fact there is even a difficulty setting that completely hides ALL of the HUD elements, including interaction prompts, but I don't recommend it for your first playthrough.

• Okay but what about [b]combat[/b]? Combat is pretty fun. Weapons feel very responsive and enemies react to it realistically; for example, monsters slow down or halt their charge if you shoot them in the face. You also get plenty of options to modify your guns, such as adding night-vision scope, or silencer. However, while combat is enjoyable, enemy encounters can feel a bit repetitive due to limited enemy variety.

• The [b]AI behaviour[/b] for both human and mutants is a bit simplistic, but it doesn't significantly detract from the overall tension or experience. And it's a pretty old game so I think it's somewhat excusable.

• The [b]sound[/b] in Metro 2033 is very decent but it has its flaws. Sometimes the dialogue volume can be quite low in comparison with effects, and the game doesn't offer detailed sound settings. Still, the creepy ambient noises and gunfire do a great job of keeping you on edge.

• Lastly, let's talk about [b]horror elements[/b]. Is it scary? Well, that depends on your tolerance for creepy mutants and pitch-black tunnels. If your idea of horror is jump scares every five seconds, this isn't that kind of game. Metro 2033 is more about creating a constant sense of unease. It's creepy, sure, but it's not going to give you heart attack or make you sleep with the lights on. The main focus here is the story, with the horror serving as an extra layer of tension.

I think that's about it. Now you should have a clear idea as to what you are getting into. Metro 2033 Redux is a fantastic experience for those who enjoy atmospheric, story-driven games with survival mechanics, despite some minor flaws. It's a game that left a lasting impression on me, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a mix of tension, exploration, and action.

184244439.review:
Сюжет: 9/10
Сюжет в игре сильный и цепляет с самого начала. Ты играешь за Артёма, который пытается спасти своё метро и разобраться, что за Тёмные (чёрные) начали появляться. История хорошо продумана, диалоги интересные, а атмосфера метро передана отлично. Все эти узкие туннели, станции с разными группировками, радиоактивные пустоши — всё выглядит правдоподобно. Плюс, игра задаёт важные вопросы про человеческую природу, хотя иногда не хватает чуть больше деталей о второстепенных персонажах.

Геймплей: 8/10
Играть в Metro 2033 — это постоянно быть на взводе. Патронов почти всегда не хватает, фильтры для противогаза быстро заканчиваются, и из-за этого ты постоянно думаешь, как выжить. Перестрелки неплохие, но механика стрельбы местами кажется тяжёлой или неудобной. Особенно сложно, когда враги начинают тупо лезть на тебя. При этом уровень напряжения от скрытности и исследования — отличный. Поверхность с её опасностями, мутантами и атмосферой разрухи добавляет разнообразия.

Metro 2033 Redux — это интересная игра с классным сюжетом и продуманным миром. Геймплей иногда раздражает мелкими недоработками, но в целом ощущения от выживания переданы здорово. Если любишь что-то мрачное и атмосферное, игра точно для тебя.

184227928.review:
[i](~20 hrs played, completed in 2024 on RTX 4070 Super)[/i]

First Metro experience. Played Spartan mode with Russian voice acting + subtitles

[b]PROS:[/b]
[list]
  [*] Gunplay feels responsive and impactful even in 2024
  [*] Graphics hold up remarkably well, especially atmospheric lighting
  [*] Resource scarcity + intense firefights nail the survival horror feel
  [*] Dual difficulty modes (Spartan/Survival) offer great replay value
  [*] Solid performance on modern hardware
[/list]

[b]CONS:[/b]
[list]
  [*] 30 FPS cutscenes feel dated
  [*] Some frustrating level design chokepoints
  [*] Steam Cloud saves unreliable between devices (lost progress switching PC)
[/list]

[b]GAMEPLAY:[/b]
Mix of stealth, scavenging, and combat through metro tunnels and irradiated surface. Story follows Artyom defending underground Metro society [spoiler]from mysterious Dark Ones.[/spoiler]

[b]VALUE:[/b]
Currently $20 full price, frequently on sale for $2-5. Worth full price, absolute steal on discount. ~15 hours for first playthrough.

[b]TIPS:[/b]
[list]
  [*] Start with Spartan mode for first playthrough
  [*] Russian/Ukrainian audio is essential for immersion
  [*] Similar to STALKER, Fallout (survival aspects), Resident Evil (horror)
[/list]

✓ Recommended, especially for survival horror/FPS fans

以下是游戏里没教的部分
按G戴上防毒面具，单击G擦拭面罩，长按G摘下面罩
捡到夜视仪后按N戴上，长按F拿出充电器，按左键给夜视仪充电
气枪，电磁枪，喷火枪使用前长按R再按左键打气/充电

游戏中存在“道德点”这个设定，道德点足够才能解锁隐藏结局，具体可以去b站搜索，总体就是搜每一个看得见的尸体，和每一个会说话的NPC对话（听NPC讲话）

184164032.review:
8/10
Metro 2033, el primero de la saga, es un muy buen juego con una historia decente. Sin embargo, algunos aspectos de la jugabilidad no han envejecido tan bien. Por ejemplo, enfrentarte a los bibliotecarios puede resultar frustrante. Además, el juego no explica de forma clara algunas mecánicas básicas, como recargar la energía (pulsando la tecla F), cambiar a las balas doradas, reemplazar el filtro o consultar el reloj. Yo descubrí todo esto al revisar los controles xd. En las aproximadamente 8 horas que he jugado, el juego se cerró al azar unas cinco veces. Supongo que fue porque modifiqué algunas configuraciones de video, pero no estoy seguro.... En fin, Metro 2033 es un buen juego, aunque personalmente prefiero Metro: Last Light por la mayor variedad en su jugabilidad. Aun así, para ser el primer juego de la saga, no está nada mal.

184159646.review:
[h1] Pretty Good Game, But I Had Some Issues [/h1] 
[u] 7/10 [/u] 
I'm going to keep this short. The Metro Series are FPS games based on the books by Dmitry Glukhovsky. I've never read them myself, but a friend of mine has, and apperantly they are pretty good. Anyway, the Metro world is basically an alterantive version of history, where nearly all of mankind was annihilated, and only those who were in the metro at the time of the devastating event, survived. Metro 2033 Redux is the remastered version of the first game in the series, Metro 2033. However, I had some issues with the story, or more specifically the way it's told. The first few chapters are painfully boring, you constantly get introduced to characters who seems like they will be important part of the story, but they either die like 5 minutes later, or they disappear, and are never mentioned again. This, and the fact that it feels like they are 5 voice actors in the entire game, makes it very hard to build any kind of relationship with any of the characters, and to actually care for any of them. Also, I found it very easy to get confused as to what my goal is, as you constantly get bombarded with what feels like side quests, but are actually part of the main story. I would say after chapter 5 is where they finally pick up the pace and things finally get intresting. No spoilers. Another thing that I disliked is the fact that the Nazis had russian accents, as a matter of fact everyone had very similar russian accents, making it hard to tell which faction is which or even who is who. I also had an issue with the night vision goggles. I found them in a secret area, but was never able to use them due to a glitch, but that's just a nitpick, I can do without night vision goggles. I can say quite a few positive things about the game as well. Soundtrack and atmosphere were awesome, gun play was very smooth and enjoyable, and apart from the night vision goggles, I didn't encounter any other bugs or glitches. In conclusion, Metro 2033 Redux is a pretty good game, I just wish you had time to build a deeper connection with the some of the characters, and for the story to be more focused on the main goal.

184152167.review:
Metro 2033 redux é absolutamente uma obra de arte. É um jogo que melodicamente une narrativa e gameplay, pintando o mundo com cores que você vivencia em primeira mão - as cores cinzentas e mórbidas de um mundo vazio, preenchido apenas pela sua própria escassez e pelos corpos daqueles que chegaram antes e foram menos afortunados que você. Nesse mundo caótico e tenebroso há fagulhas de vida que se agarram a qualquer resquício de esperança de um futuro melhor.

As mecânicas do jogo são muito imersivas, mas isso não significa que ele busque ser um simulador realista de combate, pois é relativamente simples de manejar todas as ferramentas que você precisa para se manter vivo. Com isso, quero dizer que todas suas ferramentas para se situar dentro do jogo são "analógicas", se tratam de ações reais no jogo, como se localizar através de uma búlsola, trocar seu filtro de ar quando começar a notar seu personagem ficando ofegante e sem ar, limpar a máscara conforme ela se suja de suor, água, lama, neve ou sangue.

No quesito de game design, alguns níveis são mais intuitivos do que outros, mas todos são extremamente ricos e densos no que diz respeito a transmitir uma mensagem sobre o mundo em que você vive. Para se localizar melhor nas missões, você deve sempre se lembrar de usar seu compasso e, mesmo assim, ainda tem um ou outro mapa que pode ser confuso.

Os gráficos são bem otimizados, rodando bem em sistemas fracos enquanto também permitindo que pessoas com computadores um pouco melhores possam se deslumbrar com lindos efeitos nas configurações mais altas. (Joguei com uma rx 5700 xt e um ryzen 3600 e com configurações relativamente cheias no fullhd pego em torno de 120 fps)

Comprei esse jogo por 8 reais num bundle com os outros 2 da trilogia (last light e exodus) e posso seguramente dizer que vale a pena por esse valor. Inclusive, fica em desconto com uma boa frequência. Se tornou um dos meus jogos preferidos e vale muito a pena jogar.

pra quem joga no linux, recomendo forçar alguma versão do proton, uma vez que fazer isso permite o game rodar sem bugs e com mais performance.

184069892.review:
[b]Плюсы:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Атмосфера. Игра создаёт мрачную и напряжённую атмосферу постапокалиптической Москвы, где игрок должен выживать в условиях постоянной опасности.
    [*]Сюжет. История о выживании людей после ядерной катастрофы увлекательна и заставляет задуматься о многих вещах.
    [*]Графика и звук. Улучшенная графика и звук по сравнению с оригинальной версией игры создают более реалистичное и захватывающее впечатление.
    [*]Геймплей. Интригующий геймплей сочетает в себе элементы стелса, боя и исследования, что делает игру разнообразной и интересной.
    [*]Разнообразие локаций. Игрок может исследовать различные районы Москвы, каждый из которых имеет свои особенности и врагов.
[/list]
[b]Минусы:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Сложность управления. Некоторые игроки могут столкнуться с проблемами при управлении персонажем, особенно в сложных ситуациях.
    [*]Технические проблемы. Иногда в игре могут возникать технические проблемы, такие как сбои или задержки.
    [*]Однообразие некоторых локаций. Некоторые локации в игре могут показаться однообразными и скучными.
    [*]Проблемы с балансом. Некоторые враги и боссы могут быть слишком сильными или слабыми, что может повлиять на баланс игры.

183987358.review:
Metro is not your typical FPS. The controls are not fast nor fluid and there are some stealth, light survival elements along with a bit of inventory management. The story is a big focus, it takes its time building up the world and preparing for what’s to come with the sequels. It doesn’t cause bad pacing and it doesn’t tire either since most of the dialogues are played during gameplay. What you get is a relaxing and slower paced experience that can be played in different ways. It looks pretty despite the age, the gameplay is something different, it’s interesting, I like the lore & set-up, the weapon customisation with parts is neat, it’s atmospheric and it makes me interested in playing the other games. The achievements are good, they’re doable and a lot of them come naturally. 

Even though the game is impressive and there is little to complain about, you can tell where corners were cut in terms of budget. You can notice it mostly with the re-used NPC character models, voice actors and some bugs. A lot of the voice actors are used for multiple characters, there is like one voice actor for all the kids etc. With bugs, I’ve had rare moments where events won’t trigger, forcing me to reload the last checkpoint/chapter in order to progress. Or the volume of the voice actors is reduced excessively.  Lastly, the achievement tracking is reset if you start a new save. This is weird considering how re-playable the game is and there are 2 achievements related to completing the game at least twice. Again though, the achievements are not too bad. So the grind is kept to a minimum unless you hate playing a game a second time. 

Overall, Metro 2033 Redux is great, especially for a first experience for a series. The game can be easily gotten with 90% off and it’s certainly worth it. It took me around 32 hours to get 100% with the achievements but I wasn’t exactly efficient with my time. I didn’t look up the most optimised way to get most of the achievements and it took me a long time to search for the 50+ collectibles (notes). One run can be finished fairly quickly.

Наконец то я пришел к тому, что решился потрогать серию игр Метро. Начал разумеется с данной части, так как она знакомит с этим миром. Я однажды начинал читать книгу Метро 2033, но так и не дочитал до конца, однако начало книги я более менее помнил. Игра началась плюс минус по такому же сюжету, однако на сколько я понимаю серия игр пошла по иному пути развития сюжета, нежели книги, что мне в принципе не важно, так как я пришел сюда не докапываться до канона, а просто попробовать насладиться атмосферой постядерной жизни в метро и возможно подцепить какие нибудь советы и лайфхаки по выживанию в таком мире (мало ли в ирл пригодится).
Итак, попыток поиграть в данную часть у меня было несколько и как вы успели понять увенчалась успехом лишь крайняя. До этого меня немного отталкивала атмосфера (хотя я вроде как именно за ней и шел сюда), сюжет (как то долго раскачивался имхо), и механика стрельбы и интеллект нпс (как то не получалось норм стрелять и иногда поведение вражеских нпс не совсем было понятно мягко сказано). Однако по итогу все это оказалось лишь пылью в глаза, так как сама жемчужина этой игры раскрывалась дальше. Сюжет раскачегарился, к механике привык, атмосфера начала захватывать и погружать. Прошел игру можно сказать на одном дыхании. Очень хороший продукт на деле оказался и я рад, что в дальнейшем тебя ждут еще 2 части данной игры, чтобы еще дольше покайфовать.
К покупке рекомендую уже авансом все 3 части игры, так как они стоят того, чтобы их пройти. Да и цены на них очень небольшие, когда действуют скидки.

183971050.review: What a fantastic game with a really well realised setting. The game then does a fabulous job at immersing you in the setting through seemingly useless gameplay mechanics. With those being your gas mask fogging up, your gas mask cracking when taking damage, light sources (such as torches being shone in your eyes) affecting your entire screen, having as little UI as possible (with the hardest difficulty removing it completely), being able to give money to the poor and other similar actions that give you no benefit, your breathing getting progressively heavier as the filter gets used up, and probably a few other things I cant remember. The idle chit chat that the npc's make which are each very realistic conversations with often a somber theme to reflect the setting. The gameplay is fun and also fits the setting as a lot of the guns in the game have a home-made feeling to them. The story is good [spoiler] but my only gripe is that the game heavily Implies that the "enlightened" ending the good ending. In my opinion there is not enough information is given about the black ones in order to show them in a good light whatsoever. They torture people by making them go insane, they try to stop you from destroying their nest. if you ever try to embrace the black one's influence then you die (apart from the very end). I don't think the black ones are portrayed well enough to be good creatures to justify knocking down the target laser(?) [/spoiler]. I got this game on a 90% sale and for that price it is a fantastic deal. In my opinion the original price tag is a little too high for the amount of hours you get out of it so i would say get it on any sort of sale, even if its 10%.

183955453.review:
This was a fun game!  At first it seemed a bit slow-paced and dated (it's certainly been a long time since it came out).  But as the game went on and I was able to get more into the general mythos and world-building, it became much more intriguing and quite a bit more enjoyable.  Some of the more creative (and powerful) later weapons definitely helped.  

And although I was generally looking forward to completing it (and moving on to another game), but by the time I finished it, it made me want to jump right into the next game in the series so that I can see how the plot continues.  The atmosphere was definitely creepy and even on "Normal" difficulty, it's pretty easy to die fairly often (though I had no trouble having enough items and supplies).  So you have to be in that sort of mood to play it, and you don't want the room you're playing in to be too bright either.

One problem however is that the game crashed on me pretty frequently, and 2-3 times it made my whole system freeze.  This was super annoying.  Putting "-winxp" in the properties for launching the game helped somewhat, but not at all fully.  Unchecking "advanced physx" in the game settings was the only thing that let me complete one of the levels, and sometimes it helped me progress further on (after a crash) before I turned that setting back on again.  The save points were usually very frequent, so this wasn't a major issue for getting through the game, but quite annoying.  Just a forewarning on all that.

All that to say: there's clearly a reason the Metro series is so frequently referenced - it's very memorable and a very well-made game.  Took me almost 20 hours to complete it (that did include some idle time), so I bet an average gamer would complete it in 12-15.

183787090.review:
When I was at school, I liked reading novels after finishing my homework during the evening self-study. One day during the evening self-study, after I had completed my homework and felt bored, I casually asked the student sitting behind me for a novel. That novel was called "Metro 2033", and it has left a deep impression on me ever since. The bravery of the protagonist deeply touched me, and the ending brought me a crazy sense of science fiction shock. Who could have guessed that those dark undead creatures were trying to save humanity?
When I grew up and got a computer, I was lucky enough to play the game based on it. The game has excellent graphics, and its plot is quite moving. In the post-apocalyptic world, the good and evil of human nature are magnified infinitely. Humans launched wars for their own interests and fired nuclear bombs, which led to countless casualties. The glorious and beautiful human civilization ceased to exist, leaving only the poisonous air, the despairing monsters and the crazy minds.
It makes us reflect on the devastating consequences of war and the resilience and fragility of human civilization in the face of disasters. After playing this game, it was like experiencing a thrilling underground odyssey. I deeply realized that even in the dark abyss, the glimmer of human nature is still the most worthy thing to hold on to and cherish. It also makes us cherish the relatively peaceful and stable living environment we have now and think about the meaning and value of the continuation of civilization.
Friends who are reading this review, we should reflect on whether the wars, big or small, happening all over the world nowadays are reasonable. We should join hands and move forward towards a better future instead of destroying our Mother Earth.

183685750.review:
Always heard amazing things about 2033 and Last Light, but if this is the better one of the two, I am astonished. Don't get what people are on about at all. It feels like a parody of a immersive survival-horror game, and I feel like I'm going crazy seeing so many people praise a game that reminds me more of a Call of Duty campaign with all the polish knocked off, than something like Stalker mixed with Half-Life like some say. 

My second attempt playing this game, and it's just really bad. The writing is awful, as if the player is a huge moron who needs everything exposed to themselves constantly. For someone who grew up in the metro, Artyom sure needs everything explained a million times. The voice acting is even worse, like they didn't have a director or something. Doesn't help that each character pronounces everything different, with those awful fake accents. Haven't seen a character act anything like a real person at all in the first hour, either. All stereotypes and caricatures of what a person might be, people just don't talk like this in real life, ever. 

The first hours saddle you up with friendly NPCs that feel like they're made out of cardboard. They don't react to were your standing, what you are doing, whether or not everyone's dying, etc. Really doesn't help selling that great immersion it tries to sell you on. Didn't feel immersed at any point to be honest. The game has a vibe, but that's all in that department. Nothing about the writing, worldbuilding, moment-to-moment gameplay, or overal structure helps the player get immersed. Also, ammo EVERYWHERE, even though the game boasts it being scarce and about survival. Combat feels terrible on top of it all. The enemies don't react, walk through you constantly, and don't react to being shot at.

Also, there are no subtitles for anything non-essential, no settings for resolution or field-of-view, A TON of bugs, most visual, no audio settings, and all of this for a REDUX.

183658261.review:
Very tense and immersive survival horror -esque shooter. It's just a shame I had to tweak so much to even make the damn thing worth playing. Steam's new capture software kept crashing the game, which took a while to figure out. The game also comes from the era where developers were adding all kinds of stupid acceleration to gamepads and mice, and also having the X and Y values for sensitivity be different. Stupid stuff I'm glad we typically don't have to deal with anymore. These issues can be fixed in the config file, but it was still anger inducing. Last complaint would be that the pause menu is very annoying to navigate. You have to click like five things every time you want to change the sensitivity or audio.

The game is very pretty, even as it approaches ten years old. I love the notes it takes from Far Cry 2 and Dead Space, having most of the UI be immersive in game items instead of cluttered lines of text on screen (Also for the love of God play Ranger instead of Ranger Hardcore for a first playthrough, spent like ten minutes trying to put the gas mask on and just started over). Some of the gunshot sound effects are only slightly better than stock, but the gunplay still manages to be very satisfying and tense. Tense and satisfying perfectly describes my experience so far.

P.S.: Your lighter can burn cobwebs. The game never tells you that and I thought I was softlocked at one point.

如果你是跟我一样以很划算的价格买的Metro Saga Bundle捆绑包 强烈建议游玩。Metro 2033 Redux本质上就是原版2033的高清HD版本 并不是所谓的完全重制版 画质也符合当时发行的年代。可玩性可圈可点的 每一个武器和装备都有他的存在的意义 打怪无脑用霰弹和燃烧弹基本可以平推 遇到纳粹和土匪用步枪和气枪也应付 你甚至可以小李飞刀一刀一个。弹药储备方面 你只要一路上有细心搜刮物资的习惯 一般不存在弹药匮乏的情况。地铁系列具有一个很巧妙的元素就是道德点 全程见人就杀到最后不可避免就会错过大部分的道德点（有些很好触发 听听对话就行 有些则要部分章节不杀一人  最好还是提前看一下攻略 steam社区有详细的攻略可以参考） 从而大概率会触发坏结局  若想达成完美结局 那就得收集足够的道德点 同时玩家可以充分体验游戏安排的每个细节。游戏剧情本身也够硬 毕竟改编自同名的小说 游戏呈现的也很好 喜欢第一部的话可以接着玩剩下两部。
最后提一嘴 我玩这游戏五小时不到就通关了但是为了达成全成就花了不少时间 中途遇到了恶性bug重开了一次 51个笔记必须得要一个流程捡完 错过了就得重开 这点就很糟心 各种武器击杀成就可以通过读档累计完成 Weaponsmith也必须在一个流程完成 具体可以参考社区攻略 建议二周目边玩边看 不然很容易漏掉 希望能帮到大家

183554110.review: A hesitant recommendation. Looks and plays great. Weapons were unique and satisfying, though shotguns and melee attacks lacked heft, and limited loadouts left little room to experiment. Levels were short and linear, literally a rail shooter at some points but decently atmospheric. Survival mechanics were shallow, radiation was alluded to but never seemed to matter; the gaskmask was very cool but searching for filters and scrounging for ammo seemed generally unnecessary in such a linear world. The story and setting were directionally interesting but largely confusing and unexplained; while characters and locations were generally unmemorable. I doubt I'll ever replay this game but it was fun and interesting enough to spur me to buy the book and continue the series.

183550249.review:
그래픽 상향 - 누구나 아는 사실 이외에 설명할 점은 광원이 좀 더 다양해지고 밝아져 가시성이 좋아 졌지만, 아무래도 사실성이나 음침한 분위기는 오리지널에 비해 약간은 죽은 느낌입니다.

게임 연출방식 변경 - 부분부분 스킵 가능한 컷씬과 3인칭카메라로 보여지던 전개와 달리 콜옵처럼 완벽하게 1인칭 시점으로 흐름의 끊김없이 연출이 계속 이어지며, 오리지널의 세부적인 챕터 몇 군데가 뭉쳐져 로딩 횟수가 약간이지만 줄었습니다.

세부적인 맵 구조 변경 - 몇몇 챕터의 맵이 큰 틀의 변화 없이 약간 변화가 되었거나 숨겨진 공간이 좀 더 추가되었습니다. 맵 오브젝트나 건물 내 각종 집기들의 구조나 종류가 좀 더 다양해져 약간 황량한 느낌에서 그나마 핵폭발로 지저분해진 느낌이 좀 더 잘 나타납니다.

난이도의 세분화 - 기존의 이지,노멀,하드코어, 레인저 이지, 레인저 하드코어에서 이지가 사라졌으며 상위 분류로 서바이벌과 스파르탄 난이도가 추가되었습니다. 두 난이도 차이점은 인게임에서 장황하게 설명되어 있지만 실제 체감되는 차이는
방독면필터 시간(이하 서바이벌/스파르탄) - 3분/5분
필터 최대보유시간-20분/30분
필터타이머 시계 - 아날로그/디지털
모든 무기의 장전속도 느림/빠름.
이 외의 전투시 적 등장숫자나 받는 데미지 입히는 데미지, UI표기여부 등은 전부 하위분류 난이도(노멀~레인저 등)에 따라 차이가 날 뿐입니다. 개인적으론 굳이 이런식으로 나눠서 도전과제 때문에 2회차를 강제하는 게 썩 마음에 들지는 않았습니다.

쉬워진 잠입플레이 - 기존 은신 시스템과 달리 시계 불이 들어오고 안들어오고 2가지로 바뀌었고 은신복/대형아머 등의 요소도 사라져 은신플레이가 훨 쉬워졌습니다. 광원이 닿는 곳만 아니라면 적의 코앞에 가만히 있기만 해도 발각되지 않으며 오리지널에 비해 발각범위가 현저하게 감소해 웬만한 거리에서 뛰어다녀도 적들의 의심을 사지 않습니다. 시시해짐과 동시에 간편해져 좋은 점도 있습니다.

게임전반의 시스템 및 UI변경 - 기존의 메트로 라스트 라이트처럼 총알 갯수 제한, 총기 종류별로 1정씩 3정 보유하던 것에서 종류무관 3정(레인저는 2정)으로 변경, 수류탄 투척방식 변경, 단검 투척방식 변경, 거래 방식 변경, 총기 커스터마이징 추가 등이 있습니다.

총평 - 기존작을 억지로 했던 유저가 아니라면 메트로 라스트라이트 리덕스와는 달리 2033 리덕스는 꼭 한 번 해볼만 합니다. 생각보다 바뀐 점을 많이 발견할 수 있으며, 그런것들을 찾아보는 재미도 쏠쏠합니다. 다만 메트로 라스트라이트는 광원효과 말고는 상술된 요소중에 바뀐 점이 하나도 없으니 참고하시길.

183522288.review:
Nie wiem kto wymyślił to intro, które jest przy każdym włączeniu gry i nie da się go pominąć.

Fabuła jest nudna. Dialogi też są nudne i przedłużone, a niektórzy mówią tak, jakby się dopiero uczyli składać zdania. Być może to kwestia gównianego angielskiego dubbingu, ale długość dialogu i tak się nie zmienia. Żadna postać się nie wyróżnia. Jedyna ciekawsza rzecz to końcówka gry.

Cały czas spotykasz losowych ludzi, którzy od buta stają się twoimi przyjaciółmi, ale i tak zaraz zginą, żebyś mógł poznać nowego kolegę. Często musiałem czekać na NPCtów, żeby przejść dalej, a im się zbytnio nie spieszyło. Dosłownie przechodzę gdzieś w sekundę i widzę jak mój towarzysz skrada się przez minutę. No ale przecież nie mogę sam otworzyć drzwi, muszę poczekać, aż ktoś to zrobi.

Mała różnorodność broni i ulepszeń. Dostajemy noktowizor, ale nie da się go włączyć. Powtarzalna i łatwa walka, bo zróżnicowanie przeciwników też jest małe. Uciekanie od goryli jak w jakimś outlaście, miało być strasznie, a wyszło śmiesznie.

Dziwne decyzje twórców, typu: musisz wyjąć zapalniczkę i spalić pajęczynę, żeby przejść dalej, mimo że wcześniej przez pajęczyny można było normalnie przechodzić. Nie wiem po co jest ładowanie latarki(i czy było gdzieś powiedziane, że się ją ładuje), przez chwile myślałem, że się zbugowała i biegałem po ciemku xd

Gra w pewnym momencie tak mi scrashowała, że jedyne co mogłem zrobić to restart komputera. Po ponownym włączeniu gry nie miałem żadnej amunicji i musiałem przez cały poziom rzucać w przeciwników nożami xd 

ALE gra kosztuje 5zł i jest na 6 godzin. Można zagrać, pozwalam.
